content.title: Intro
content.content: -nna means "to, upon" in Quenya, allative ending in cilyanna, Endorenna,[1][2] Elendilenna, Elenna,[3] númenna, númenórenna, rómenna, tielyanna. Plural -nnar in mannar, valannar.[source?]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, The Return of the King, "The Steward and the King", Elendil's Oath
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, "Words, Phrases and Passages in Various Tongues in The Lord of the Rings", in Parma Eldalamberon XVII (edited by Christopher Gilson), p.103
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, Christopher Tolkien (ed.), The Silmarillion, "Index of Names"
